Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
June 2022 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

The Justia Insider celebrates its second anniversary! As our company has evolved, so has the newsletter. We thank you all for joining us on this journey! We are also thrilled about the recent launch of two new products: Justia Elevate and Justia Connect Pro. Much has changed over the past year, and we foresee many more exciting updates on the horizon. We are incredibly excited about Justia Connect Pro, a membership program that will help our clients with their professional and practice-growth goals. We are looking forward to seeing more people taking advantage of this new upgrade!

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Connect PRO: A big one! Our team released the latest main Justia product: Justia Connect PRO, our paid membership program. It was a company-wide massive effort that involved updates of multiple properties, products and marketing campaigns.

Amplify Google APIs: We completed the migration of the projects that use Google Ads and Google Business Profiles APIs to the latest versions to guarantee uninterrupted services for our Amplify clients.

Data Reports: Our Data Team analyzed the Lawyer Directory Peer & Client Reviews for the month. After further discussion with our Product Team, we came up with an action plan to improve the numbers to help us reach our yearly goal.

IT Maintenance: As part of our ongoing efforts, there were multiple IT maintenance actions during this month, including the migration of the Dockets infrastructure and our internal projects servers, to name a few.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal
  • Additional Snippets. We have improved the accessibility and clarity of the Bankruptcy Legal Guide by writing more snippets to highlight key points in this area.
  • Final Case Law Outlines. We have concluded writing case outlines for law school elective courses, such as Real Estate Transactions, Securities Law, and Local Government Law. Look for those to be posted in the Justia Law Schools center in June!
  • Review of Supreme Court Site. We have started identifying areas for improvement in our U.S. Supreme Court site's case overview pages and home page. The design team will be putting together some great new visuals shortly.
  • Onward Blog Posts Highlighting Justia Legal Guides. We wrote a couple of posts on our Justia Onward blog explaining how consumers could use our Intellectual Property Center and our Products Liability Center.
  • Justia Mexico Portal. Our team continues expanding the resources available on the Justia Mexico Portal. We recently added new pages to the Intellectual Property Center regarding trademark licensing, copyright assignments, book publication, music publication agreements, and software copyright matters.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Genaro Osoria

Intern - Help Desk

Hi, I am Genaro! I am a hard-working individual who studies at the Technical University of Coahuila. I have a motivated mindset, and I am always trying to learn new skills. I am adept at various social media platforms and tech programs, and I like to listen to music in my free time. I am currently working hard to learn more languages, and one of my most significant objectives in life is to become a polyglot.

I used to sing in different local choruses at the university, and I like new experiences. My goal in life is to always do my best in everything I do.

DID YOU KNOW?

Justia Attended Student Events at a Local University

On May 19th, Justia participated in an event organized by the Computer Systems Engineering Student Chapter at the Technical Institute of Saltillo with the presentation “The Importance of Legal Aspects for a Tech Startup” presented by Claudia Duque. We had a very dynamic event where the attendees got involved with comments and questions related to the topic.

On May 24th and 25th, Justia participated in the DevWeek 2022 student group Bee Developers event. Angel Ponce participated with the conference: “A Short Story of Web Performance from Page Speed to Core Vitals,” and Claudia Duque presented “The Importance of Legal Aspects for a Tech Startup.”

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

Father's Day (Mexico & U.S.) June 20th*

In Mexico and the U.S., people celebrate Father’s Day on the third Sunday of June (it is not a public holiday, though). It is an observance to honor fathers and male parental figures in both countries. On this day, people thank all those men who set solid examples and guided them throughout their lives. Don’t miss the opportunity to express your love, appreciation, and gratitude

Pride Month
June 28th*

Pride Month is celebrated each June to honor the 1969 Stonewall Uprising in Manhattan. It commemorates years of struggle for civil rights and the ongoing pursuit of equal justice under the law for LGBTQ individuals. Most people gather together with colorful parades, festivals, picnics, and parties.

*This is a non-federal holiday. It is not officially recognized. For more information about paid holidays please visit Justikia.

TEAM ACTIVITies

Justia Elevate and Justia Connect Pro Launch Party

On Monday, May 9th, we had an unprecedented event at Justia. The Justia Elevate and Justia Connect Pro Launch Party! In addition to the commemorative t-shirts, everyone received fabulous party supplies in a mystery box. Everyone enjoyed the party, and the magician’s presentation was simply incredible. We want to give special thanks to the people involved in the organization and for everyone’s cooperation and enthusiastic participation.

Virtual Just Meet Up!

On May 26th, we had another session of the Just Meet Up! Hector Lugo shared professional advice regarding one of the most critical aspects of career development; the resume. We had participants from all over the country.

REVIEWs & RECOMMENDATIONs

14 Best Youtube Channels for Designers in 2022

In the field of design, it is essential to attain knowledge and inspiration about different trends and tools in UX, UI, logos, photography, photo and video editing, and other related topics. Do not panic! You can learn in a self-taught way; it doesn't matter if you are a professional or a beginner. A good practice is to learn from the professional experiences that others share. I recommend reading this article about YouTube channels created by talented people as they go over different design topics and share knowledge that could help with daily work.

- Claudia Duque
